pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday, May 17, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Wednesday, May 17, 2017:

Montréal, Quebec

7:45 a.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will be greeted at Montréal City Hall by the Mayor of Montréal, Denis Coderre, prior to a mass celebrating the 375th anniversary of the founding of Montréal.

Montréal City Hall
275 Notre-Dame Street East
Montréal, Quebec

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage of arrival
  • Media should arrive no later than 7:15 a.m.

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau, accompanied by the Premier of Quebec, Philippe Couillard, Mayor Coderre and his spouse, Ms. Chantale Renaud, will depart City Hall for Notre-Dame Basilica by foot.

Main steps
Montréal City Hall
275 Notre-Dame Street East
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

8:45 a.m. The Prime Minister, Ms. Grégoire Trudeau, the Premier of Quebec, Mayor Coderre and his spouse, Ms. Chantale Renaud, will be greeted by Mgr Christian Lépine, Archbishop of Montréal, at Notre-Dame Basilica.

Notre-Dame Basilica
110 Notre-Dame Street West
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will attend a mass marking the 375th anniversary of the founding of Montréal. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks.

Notre-Dame Basilica
110 Notre-Dame Street West
Montréal, Quebec

Notes for media:

  • Pooled camera and photography coverage
  • Open coverage for journalists

10:30 a.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will attend a ceremony commemorating the founders of Montréal. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks.

Place d’Armes
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

12:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will depart for Redmond, Washington, United States of America.


Redmond, Washington, United States of America

3:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Microsoft CEO Summit at the Microsoft Redmond campus.

Closed to media

4:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will address the Microsoft CEO Summit at the Microsoft Redmond campus.

Closed to media.


Media appearances

A radio interview with the Prime Minister for Le 15-18 with Annie Desrochers will air on Radio-Canada Première Montréal at 4:15 p.m. ET.
An interview with the Prime Minister for TVA will air throughout the day.


Note: all times local
